text: Father Jacques Marquette S.J. (June 1, 1637 – May 18, 1675), sometimes known as Père Marquette or James Marquette,Catholic Encyclopedia (1913): Archdiocese of Chicago, Retrieved February 23, 2012 was a French Jesuit missionary. He founded Michigan's first European settlement, Sault Ste. Marie, and later founded St. Ignace, Michigan. In 1673 Father Marquette and Louis Jolliet were the first Europeans to explore and map the northern portion of the Mississippi River Valley. ==References== Category:1637 births Category:1675 deaths Category:French explorers Category:French Roman Catholic priests Category:Jesuit missionaries
title: Jacques Marquette
